account.externalId.description: Set the account value for this expense.
account.externalId.name: account.externalId

account.internalId.description: Set the account value for this expense.
account.internalId.name: account.internalId

account.name.description: Set the account value for this expense.
account.name.name: account.name

accountingApproval.description: Set to true if  this expense report is ready to pay.
accountingApproval.name: accountingApproval

acctCorpCardExp.externalId.description: Select the credit card account to use for corporate card expenses.
acctCorpCardExp.externalId.displayName: Account for Corporate Card Expenses - External id
acctCorpCardExp.externalId.name: acctCorpCardExp.externalId

acctCorpCardExp.internalId.description: Select the credit card account to use for corporate card expenses.
acctCorpCardExp.internalId.displayName: Account for Corporate Card Expenses - Internal id
acctCorpCardExp.internalId.name: acctCorpCardExp.internalId

acctCorpCardExp.name.description: Select the credit card account to use for corporate card expenses.
acctCorpCardExp.name.name: acctCorpCardExp.name

advance.description: Sets the amount advanced to employee for these expenses.
advance.name: advance

amount.description: This is a read-only field that returns the total of all expense line items minus advances.
amount.name: amount

approvalStatus.externalId.description: When you use SuiteFlow for expense report approvals, the forms now include an Approval Status field. The Approval Status field reflects the state of the transaction in the approval process.Expense reports may have one of the following statuses:    * Pending Approval – The expense is in the approval queue.    * Approved – The expense has been given approval for processing.    * Rejected – The expense has not been approved and will not be processed.
approvalStatus.externalId.name: approvalStatus.externalId

approvalStatus.internalId.description: When you use SuiteFlow for expense report approvals, the forms now include an Approval Status field. The Approval Status field reflects the state of the transaction in the approval process.Expense reports may have one of the following statuses:    * Pending Approval – The expense is in the approval queue.    * Approved – The expense has been given approval for processing.    * Rejected – The expense has not been approved and will not be processed.
approvalStatus.internalId.name: approvalStatus.internalId

approvalStatus.name.description: When you use SuiteFlow for expense report approvals, the forms now include an Approval Status field. The Approval Status field reflects the state of the transaction in the approval process.Expense reports may have one of the following statuses:    * Pending Approval – The expense is in the approval queue.    * Approved – The expense has been given approval for processing.    * Rejected – The expense has not been approved and will not be processed.
approvalStatus.name.name: approvalStatus.name

complete.description: If set to true, this expense report is is complete. If set to false, this expense report is not complete.Only complete reports are submitted for approval and processing.
complete.name: complete

customForm.externalId.description: Reference an existing custom form for this record type. To ensure that field relationships defined within a desired custom form are maintained, you must provide the customForm value. Also, if defaults are off, then customForm is required. If defaults are on then the default form is used. Internal ID values for existing forms can be found at Setup > Customization > Entry Forms. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
customForm.externalId.name: customForm.externalId

customForm.internalId.description: Reference an existing custom form for this record type. To ensure that field relationships defined within a desired custom form are maintained, you must provide the customForm value. Also, if defaults are off, then customForm is required. If defaults are on then the default form is used. Internal ID values for existing forms can be found at Setup > Customization > Entry Forms. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
customForm.internalId.name: customForm.internalId

customForm.name.description: Reference an existing custom form for this record type. To ensure that field relationships defined within a desired custom form are maintained, you must provide the customForm value. Also, if defaults are off, then customForm is required. If defaults are on then the default form is used. Internal ID values for existing forms can be found at Setup > Customization > Entry Forms. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
customForm.name.name: customForm.name

department.externalId.description: Set a department to associate with this item. For details on existing department records, in the UI go to Setup > Company > Departments.
department.externalId.name: department.externalId

department.internalId.description: Set a department to associate with this item. For details on existing department records, in the UI go to Setup > Company > Departments.
department.internalId.name: department.internalId

department.name.description: Set a department to associate with this item. For details on existing department records, in the UI go to Setup > Company > Departments.
department.name.name: department.name

dueDate.description: Sets the due date for this Expense Report.
dueDate.name: dueDate

entity.externalId.description: Sets the employee for this expense report. Required on Add.
entity.externalId.name: entity.externalId

entity.internalId.description: Sets the employee for this expense report. Required on Add.
entity.internalId.name: entity.internalId

entity.name.description: Sets the employee for this expense report. Required on Add.
entity.name.name: entity.name

location.externalId.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Locations.This field is required when Make Locations Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.
location.externalId.name: location.externalId

location.internalId.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Locations.This field is required when Make Locations Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.
location.internalId.name: location.internalId

location.name.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Locations.This field is required when Make Locations Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.
location.name.name: location.name

memo.description: Sets a description for the expense report.
memo.name: memo

nextApprover.externalId.description: When you use SuiteFlow for expense approvals, expense reports include a Next Approver field. This field is populated based on the associated workflow.For example, in your workflow you may create a state of Pending Approval. In that state you create a formula to set the Next Approver as the employee’s supervisor.
nextApprover.externalId.name: nextApprover.externalId

nextApprover.internalId.description: When you use SuiteFlow for expense approvals, expense reports include a Next Approver field. This field is populated based on the associated workflow.For example, in your workflow you may create a state of Pending Approval. In that state you create a formula to set the Next Approver as the employee’s supervisor.
nextApprover.internalId.name: nextApprover.internalId

nextApprover.name.description: When you use SuiteFlow for expense approvals, expense reports include a Next Approver field. This field is populated based on the associated workflow.For example, in your workflow you may create a state of Pending Approval. In that state you create a formula to set the Next Approver as the employee’s supervisor.
nextApprover.name.name: nextApprover.name

postingPeriod.externalId.description: Required on Add when the Accounting Periods feature is enabled. Defaults to the current posting period.
postingPeriod.externalId.name: postingPeriod.externalId

postingPeriod.internalId.description: Required on Add when the Accounting Periods feature is enabled. Defaults to the current posting period.
postingPeriod.internalId.name: postingPeriod.internalId

postingPeriod.name.description: Required on Add when the Accounting Periods feature is enabled. Defaults to the current posting period.
postingPeriod.name.name: postingPeriod.name

subsidiary.externalId.description: References a value defined at Setup > Company > Classifications > Subsidiaries.
subsidiary.externalId.name: subsidiary.externalId

subsidiary.internalId.description: References a value defined at Setup > Company > Classifications > Subsidiaries.
subsidiary.internalId.name: subsidiary.internalId

subsidiary.name.description: References a value defined at Setup > Company > Classifications > Subsidiaries.
subsidiary.name.name: subsidiary.name

supervisorApproval.description: Can only be set for roles that have approval permissions.
supervisorApproval.name: supervisorApproval

total.description: This is a read-only field that returns the total of expense item lines for the expense report.
total.name: total

tranId.description: Defaults to the largest Expense Report number incremented by 1. You can overwrite with another number.
tranId.name: tranId

type.value.description: Sets the employee for this expense report. Required on Add.
type.value.name: type.value

useMultiCurrency.description: Set to false to not allow expenses to be entered in foreign currencies on this expense report.
useMultiCurrency.name: useMultiCurrency
